Question
========
What does `install.packages("dplyr")` do?

Answerlist
----------
* Loads `dplyr` into your current R session
* Downloads and installs `dplyr` so it can be used later
* Updates R itself to the latest version
* Removes all other packages from your library

Solution
========
`install.packages()` fetches and installs the package; you still need `library(dplyr)` to use it in a session.

Answerlist
----------
* False
* True
* False
* False
